page.title: 05Hill Farm, Gatcombe
page.content: {Robbie Taylor writes:}My family have farmed on I.W. for 400yrs and we have been at Hill Farm for 200yrs. Today we rent from the Clarke family in Sussex because they bought Hill Farm from my family in 1920's. Our farm is worked with Perreton Farm at Arreton which we own. The new barn (photo) is the first new building for 300yrs. It took four days to put up the frame and four more to add the roof and sides. It replaces one burnt down which had 1107 carved on the beam. The farm is 400 acres. We grow wheat and barley, field beans for cattle food, grass for hay and silage. Most of the corn we mill and feed to the pigs at Perreton but some goes by boat to Europe for malting. After this year we are not having any more beef cattle so we will not be making silage but we will make some hay for the sheep and the ponies.
